{"step_by_step_thinking": "The infant of a diabetic mother presented with seizures after 16 hours of birth. The most likely cause of seizures in this case is hypoglycemia. Neonates of diabetic mothers are at risk for hypoglycemia due to the high insulin levels they are exposed to in utero. Hypoglycemia can lead to neurological symptoms, including seizures. Other potential causes such as hypocalcemia, birth asphyxia, and intraventricular hemorrhage may also present with seizures, but given the history of being an infant of a diabetic mother, hypoglycemia is the most likely cause.", "answer_choice": "A"}
